name: FluxzeroLogbackAppender

methods.name: append
methods.documentation:
Processes log events of level {@code WARN} or higher.

Extracts the stack trace and relevant context, transforms the message into a {@link ConsoleWarning} or {@link ConsoleError}, and sends it to the Fluxzero error gateway. @param event the logging event to be processed

methods.name: attach
methods.documentation:
Attaches this appender to the root logger in the Logback logging context.

Once attached, the appender will monitor and forward all warning and error logs to the Fluxzero error gateway as {@link ConsoleWarning} or {@link ConsoleError} messages.

Typically, this appender is configured automatically via Logback's own configuration. This method exists for dynamic attachment at runtimeâ€”e.g., during testing or in environments where programmatic logging configuration is preferred.

methods.name: detach
methods.documentation:
Detaches any active instances of this appender from the root logger.

This is useful for runtime cleanup or reconfiguration.

methods.name: getRootLogger
methods.documentation:
Returns the root logger from the SLF4J/Logback environment.

 @return the root {@link Logger}

methods.name: ignoreEvent
